title: Building Secure HTTPS Gateways for Java Applications
description:
Having applications exposed to the Internet means you must question the right and permissions of the entities accessing them. Securing a piece of software is not just enabling HTTPS or using the right tools; it is an entire setup of tools, application code, and infrastructure configurations that interface with the world.


This session will guide you on how to use Cert Manager to generate and maintain TLS/SSL certificates, integrate them in a Java-friendly way at the application level, create secure HTTPS gateways using Istio and expose those outside a Kubernetes cluster.


During this talk you'll find out how to:


  • Generate TLS/SSL certificates using Cert Manager.
  • Use Cert Manager resources within 2 Java apps (one built on top of Helidon, the other one on top of Quarkus)
  • Enable mutual authentication at the Java application level, explore recent Java language security improvements and use Istio destination rules and gateways with mutual TLS

After this talk, you'll know your options for making secure HTTPS Istio gateways for Java applications running on Kubernetes.
